alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 9:11AM EDT until September 05 at 2:51PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Carroll, Harrison and Tuscarawas. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 911 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Cadiz, Dennison, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Scio, Midvale, Port Washington, Bowerston, Barnhill, Roswell, Stone Creek, Leesville, Stillwater, Deersville, Leesville Lake Park and Tappan Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
